headings: # This script provides unified prerequisite checking for Spec-Driven Development workflow.
It replaces the functionality previously spread across multiple scripts.
--require-tasks     Require tasks.md to exist (for implementation phase)

headings: Common functions and variables for all scripts
Get repository root, with fallback for non-git repositories

This allows multiple branches to work on the same spec (e.g., 004-fix-bug, 004-add-feature)

title: Update agent context files with information from plan.md
headings: Update agent context files with information from plan.md
# This script maintains AI agent context files by parsing feature specifications
and updating agent-specific configuration files with project information.
- Verifies git repository structure and branch information
- Checks for required plan.md files and templates
- Parses plan.md files to extract project metadata
- Identifies language/version, frameworks, databases, and project types
- Handles missing or incomplete specification data gracefully
- Creates new agent context files from templates when needed
- Updates existing agent files with new project information
- Preserves manual additions and custom configurations
- Supports multiple AI agent formats and directory structures
- Updates technology stacks and recent changes sections
- Handles agent-specific file paths and naming conventions
- Supports: Claude, Gemini, Copilot, Cursor, Qwen, opencode, Codex, Windsurf, Kilo Code, Auggie CLI, Roo Code, CodeBuddy CLI, Amp, SHAI, or Amazon Q Developer CLI
- Can update single agents or all existing agent files
- Creates default Claude file if no agent files exist
Leave empty to update all existing agent files
Get script directory and load common functions
Get all paths and variables from common functions
Global variables for parsed plan data
Execute main function if script is run directly

title: CodeHero Constitution
headings: II. Dependency Governance and Supply Chain Security (NON-NEGOTIABLE)
Repository Contract and Agent Boundaries (from current codebase)
CI/CD and Branch Protection (codified from repo practices)
Authority: REQ, Spec, and the Constitution — Precedence & Conflict Resolution
